metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
aws::graph::propositions: Amazon's Financial Strategy and Customer Experience Focus
Amazon's financial focus is on long-term, sustainable growth in free cash flows.
Free cash flows are driven primarily by increasing operating income.
Free cash flows are driven by efficiently managing accounts receivable.
Free cash flows are driven by efficiently managing inventory.
Free cash flows are driven by efficiently managing accounts payable.
Free cash flows are driven by efficiently managing cash capital expenditures.
Cash capital expenditures include Amazon's decision to purchase or lease property and equipment.
Increases in operating income primarily result from increases in sales of products and services.
Increases in operating income result from efficiently managing operating costs.
Increases in operating income are partially offset by investments Amazon makes in longer-term strategic initiatives.
Longer-term strategic initiatives include capital expenditures focused on improving the customer experience.
Amazon focuses on improving all aspects of the customer experience to increase sales of products and services.
Improving the customer experience includes lowering prices.
Improving the customer experience includes improving availability.
Improving the customer experience includes offering faster delivery times.
Improving the customer experience includes offering faster performance times.
Improving the customer experience includes increasing selection.
Improving the customer experience includes producing original content.
Improving the customer experience includes increasing product categories.
Improving the customer experience includes increasing service offerings.
Improving the customer experience includes expanding product information.
Improving the customer experience includes improving ease of use.
Improving the customer experience includes improving reliability.
Improving the customer experience includes earning customer trust.
Additional information on Amazon's non-GAAP free cash flows financial measures can be found in "Results of Operations — Non-GAAP Financial Measures" section.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text: Our financial focus is on long-term, sustainable growth in free cash flows. Free cash flows are driven primarily by increasing operating income and efficiently managing accounts receivable, inventory, accounts payable, and cash capital expenditures, including our decision to purchase or lease property and equipment. Increases in operating income primarily result from increases in sales of products and services and efficiently managing our operating costs, partially offset by investments we make in longer-term strategic initiatives, including capital expenditures focused on improving the customer experience. To increase sales of products and services, we focus on improving all aspects of the customer experience, including lowering prices, improving availability, offering faster delivery and performance times, increasing selection, producing original content, increasing product categories and service offerings, expanding product information, improving ease of use, improving reliability, and earning customer trust. See “Results of Operations — Non-GAAP Financial Measures” below for additional information on our non-GAAP free cash flows financial measures.
